column4: anyone here good at solving problems with the nvidia driver? i'm having a major problem since about the day i installed ubuntu (hoary preview release)...
my problem is it just won't start anymore. it worked the first day i installed, then after the package manager had updated packages a couple of hundred times ( ;) ) it just stopped working
anyway has any clue whatsoever about the nvidia driver not starting?
i'll write a review about ubuntu hoary soon and this is about the only negative part of my install actually
in Hoary you mean ?
yes, in hoary preview.. and the nvidia driver has worked, but only for one day.. after a reboot it just stopped
unless you manually installed the nvidia driver you were probably using the open source nv driver
no, i changed from "nv" to "nvidia" in xorg.conf, and that made the Nvidia splash screen appear and it started to work
ok I also had problem with the latest 2.6??-5 kernel release + nvidia try installing the 2.6.?-4 kernel it worked for me.
Jesterace:  so the nvidia driver doesn't work with the latest kernel?
for me no :(
I have a 32 meg GF2MX card and it doesn't work on that kernel release, for me anyways.
that's exactly what i have.. almost.. 64 mb i think i have
maybe it's card specific, I can tell you that 2.6.10-4-k7 + nvidia work perfectly. You can easily download apt-get install linux-image
i will try.. i'm surprised it hasn't been downloaded already because I download like 50+ updates every day
I mean downgrade your kernel-image so it works with nvidia
ah i understand.. although i'm not very excited about downgrading the kernel... :(
you won't be downgrading just installing the last kernel release, what kernel are you running now (uname -r) ?
but there are newer kernel versions out there.. so your suggestion would still be a downgrade, right?
ok sudo -s (password) apt-get update && apt-get install linux-image-2.6.10-5-386
argh sorry make that -4
great :)
